title: Natural Resources and Environment

vocab.definition: Something from nature that people use, like water, trees, or rocks
All the living and non-living things around us
A resource that can be replaced naturally, like trees that can grow back
Using resources carefully so they don't run out
Harmful things that make the air, water, or land dirty
Using old materials to make new things instead of throwing them away

teachingNotes: Use examples from students' daily lives. Practice conservation activities like recycling. Discuss local natural resources.

sample.question: Why do we need to protect the environment?
